NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Versioning ALTER TABLE mode. ERROR: Fail ALTER with error; KEEP: Keep historical system rows and subject them to ALTER

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1, the default, secondary indexes in InnoDB tables are performed. If set to 0, storage engines can (but are not required to) assume that duplicate keys are not present in input data. Set to 0 to speed up imports of large tables to InnoDB. The storage engine will still issue a duplicate key error if it detects one, even if set to 0.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_WAITS_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

READ_ONLY: relay log will be rotated automatically when the size exceeds this value.  If 0 at startup, it's set to max_binlog_size

GLOBAL_VALUE: If RTREE indexes (used for spatial indexes) are available, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of instrumented condition objects. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Write and flush logs every (n) second.
Maximum number of instrumented RWLOCK objects. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Maximum number of instrumented prepared statements. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated scaling.
The tracing level for semi-sync replication.
Maximum number of instrumented MUTEX objects. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable the event scheduler. Possible values are ON, OFF, and DISABLED (keep the event scheduler completely deactivated, it cannot be activated run-time)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of leaf index pages to sample when calculating transient statistics (if persistent statistics are not used, default 8)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: When set, different master connections in multi-source replication are allowed to receive and process event groups with the same GTID (when using GTID mode). Only one will be applied, any others will be ignored. Within a given replication domain, just the sequence number will be used to decide whether a given GTID has been already applied; this means it is the responsibility of the user to ensure that GTID sequence numbers are strictly increasing.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If creating the thread takes longer than this value (in seconds), the Slow_launch_threads counter will be incremented

READ_ONLY: Controls number of record samples to check condition selectivity

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Timeout for the mysql connection used to kill the slave io_thread's connection on master. This timeout comes into play when stop slave is executed.
Number of InnoDB Adaptive Hash Index Partitions (default 8)
Maximum number of instrumented user@host accounts. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
How many additional active worker threads in a group are allowed.
Maximum number of rows in SETUP_OBJECTS.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Specifies how corrupted tables should be automatically repaired

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: InnoDB Fulltext search number of words to optimize for each optimize table call
Maximum number of index statistics for instrumented tables. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated scaling.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable a workaround to handle the cases where inserting a DEFAULT value into an auto-increment column could fail with duplicate key error

READ_ONLY: If an internal in-memory temporary table exceeds this size, MariaDB will automatically convert it to an on-disk MyISAM or Aria table. Same as tmp_table_size.
Max number of bytes in sorted records

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Hostname or IP of the slave to be reported to the master during slave registration. Will appear in the output of SHOW SLAVE HOSTS. Leave unset if you do not want the slave to register itself with the master. Note that it is not sufficient for the master to simply read the IP of the slave off the socket once the slave connects. Due to NAT and other routing issues, that IP may not be valid for connecting to the slave from the master or other hosts

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_STAGES_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Memory buffer size for index creation
Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_STATEMENTS_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Tells the slave thread to retry transaction for replication when a query event returns an error from the provided list. Deadlock error, elapsed lock wait timeout, net read error, net read timeout, net write error, net write timeout, connect error and 2 types of lost connection error are automatically added to this list

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Whether mysqld was compiled with options for large file support

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of rows in SETUP_ACTORS.

This characterizes the number of hits a hot block has to be untouched until it is considered aged enough to be downgraded to a warm block. This specifies the percentage ratio of that number of hits to the total number of blocks in the page cache.
Size of session attribute string buffer per thread. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: To automatically control the assignment of autoincrement variables

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The default storage engine for new tables

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: After inserting delayed_insert_limit rows, the INSERT DELAYED handler will check if there are any SELECT statements pending. If so, it allows these to execute before continuing.

READ_ONLY: The maximum length of the result of function GROUP_CONCAT()

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The size of file cache for the binary log

READ_ONLY: Allocation block size for storing ranges during optimization

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Log slow queries to a table or log file. Defaults logging to a file 'hostname'-slow.log or a table mysql.slow_log if --log-output=TABLE is used. Must be enabled to activate other slow log options.

GLOBAL_VALUE: Value of the COMPILATION_COMMENT option specified by CMake when building MariaDB, for example mariadb.org binary distribution.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_TRANSACTIONS_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Number of threads performing background key rotation

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Specifies how corrupted tables should be automatically repaired

READ_ONLY: zlib compression level (1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The timeout value (in ms) for semi-synchronous replication in the master
Number of rows in EVENTS_STAGES_HISTORY_LONG. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: INSERT/DELETE/UPDATE has lower priority than selects

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The character set used for returning query results to the client
The account password of the slave to be reported to the master during slave registration

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of consecutive log recovery failures after which logs will be automatically deleted to cure the problem; 0 (the default) disables the feature.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The character set used for literals that do not have a character set introducer and for number-to-string conversion

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 0, MariaDB will not perform large SELECTs. See max_join_size for details. If max_join_size is set to anything but DEFAULT, sql_big_selects is automatically set to 0. If sql_big_selects is again set, max_join_size will be ignored.

READ_ONLY: The size of the buffer that is used for joins
Allocation block size for transactions to be stored in binary log

Controls the heuristic(s) applied during query optimization to prune less-promising partial plans from the optimizer search space. Meaning: 0 - do not apply any heuristic, thus perform exhaustive search; 1 - prune plans based on number of retrieved rows

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of iterations over which the background flushing is averaged.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: This option causes CREATE TABLE to create all TIMESTAMP columns as NULL with DEFAULT NULL attribute, Without this option, TIMESTAMP columns are NOT NULL and have implicit DEFAULT clauses.
Sync .frm files to disk on creation

Controls whether metadata is logged using FULL , MINIMAL format and NO_LOG.FULL causes all metadata to be logged; MINIMAL means that only metadata actually required by slave is logged; NO_LOG NO metadata will be logged.Default: NO_LOG.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Path to the database root directory

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: This characterizes the number of hits a hot block has to be untouched until it is considered aged enough to be downgraded to a warm block. This specifies the percentage ratio of that number of hits to the total number of blocks in key cache
Limit to which innodb_io_capacity can be inflated.
Number of IOPs the server can do. Tunes the background IO rate
Number of rows in EVENTS_TRANSACTIONS_HISTORY_LONG. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Address to initially connect to cluster

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Minimum length of sql statement(in statement mode) or record(in row mode)that can be compressed.
Size of the statement digest. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Don't cache results that are bigger than this

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: global transaction position to start from

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Is compression the default for new tables

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of instrumented threads. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Data file autoextend increment in megabytes

READ_ONLY: Offset added to Auto-increment columns. Used when auto-increment-increment != 1

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Default pointer size to be used for MyISAM tables

READ_ONLY: Alias for tmp_memory_table_size. If an internal in-memory temporary table exceeds this size, MariaDB will automatically convert it to an on-disk MyISAM or Aria table.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Only write master info file when ack is needed.
Creating and dropping stored procedures alters ACLs

If set to 1, the query SELECT * FROM table_name WHERE auto_increment_column IS NULL will return an auto-increment that has just been successfully inserted, the same as the LAST_INSERT_ID() function. Some ODBC programs make use of this IS NULL comparison.

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Whether temporary tables should be MyISAM or Aria

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of best matches to use for query expansion

GLOBAL_VALUE: If the server supports spatial data types, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of instrumented programs. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated scaling.

READ_ONLY: Max number of times to retry a failed autocommit statement

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of hash buckets for open and changed files.  If you have a lot of MyISAM files open you should increase this for faster flush of changes. A good value is probably 1/10 of number of possible open MyISAM files.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable InnoDB lock monitor output to the error log. Requires innodb_status_output=ON.

READ_ONLY: Timeout in seconds to wait for a lock before returning an error.
Persistent buffer for query parsing and execution
The maximum number of active connections for a single user (0 = no limit)
Each thread that needs to do a sort allocates a buffer of this size

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Binary log will be rotated automatically when the size exceeds this value.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Roll back the complete transaction on lock wait timeout, for 4.x compatibility (disabled by default)

Specifies how MyISAM tables handles CREATE TABLE DELAY_KEY_WRITE. If set to ON, the default, any DELAY KEY WRITEs are honored. The key buffer is then flushed only when the table closes, speeding up writes. MyISAM tables should be automatically checked upon startup in this case, and --external locking should not be used, as it can lead to index corruption. If set to OFF, DELAY KEY WRITEs are ignored, while if set to ALL, all new opened tables are treated as if created with DELAY KEY WRITEs enabled.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Allow only CTEs compliant to SQL standard

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of rows in EVENTS_WAITS_HISTORY_LONG. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

READ_ONLY: Number of threads to use when repairing Aria tables. The value of 1 disables parallel repair.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: A query that has taken more than max_statement_time seconds will be aborted. The argument will be treated as a decimal value with microsecond precision. A value of 0 (default) means no timeout

READ_ONLY: The limit of the space for all join buffers used by a query

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_STATEMENTS_CURRENT.
Maximum number of instrumented tables. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

READ_ONLY: Seconds between sending progress reports to the client for time-consuming statements. Set to 0 to disable progress reporting.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: if disabled - do not purge relay logs. if enabled - purge them as soon as they are no more needed.

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Tells the slave thread to restrict replication to statements where any of the updated tables match the specified database and table name patterns.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Generate zlib header and trailer and compute adler32 check value. It can be used with storage engines that don't provide data integrity verification to detect data corruption.

READ_ONLY: Max packet length to send to or receive from the server

GLOBAL_VALUE: The character set used by the server for storing identifiers

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The maximum packet length to sent successfully from the master to slave.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Sets the internal state of the RAND() generator for replication purposes

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If there is more than this number of interrupted connections from a host this host will be blocked from further connections

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Enable InnoDB locking in LOCK TABLES

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Tells the slave thread not to replicate any statement that updates the specified table, even if any other tables might be updated by the same statement.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Causes updates to non-transactional engines using statement format to be written directly to binary log. Before using this option make sure that there are no dependencies between transactional and non-transactional tables such as in the statement INSERT INTO t_myisam SELECT * FROM t_innodb; otherwise, slaves may diverge from the master.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of simultaneous clients allowed

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Use strict mode when evaluating create options.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of seconds the mysqld server is waiting for a connect packet before responding with 'Bad handshake'

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Maintain page checksums (can be overridden per table with PAGE_CHECKSUM clause in CREATE TABLE)

READ_ONLY: Don't allow creation of heap tables bigger than this

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Variable to set to reject queries

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Use stopwords from this file instead of built-in list

READ_ONLY: The number of seconds the server waits for idle transaction

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If non-zero, binary logs will be purged after expire_logs_days days; possible purges happen at startup and at binary log rotation

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Verbosity level for the slow log

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: What size queue (in rows) should be allocated for handling INSERT DELAYED. If the queue becomes full, any client that does INSERT DELAYED will wait until there is room in the queue again
Timeout in seconds for an idle thread in the thread pool.Worker thread will be shut down after timeout
The maximum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index. Note: FULLTEXT indexes must be rebuilt after changing this variable

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: The algorithm Innodb uses for deciding which locks to grant next when a lock is released. Possible values are FCFS grant the locks in First-Come-First-Served order; VATS use the Variance-Aware-Transaction-Scheduling algorithm, which uses an Eldest-Transaction-First heuristic.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum length considered for digest text.
Maximum number of lock statistics for instrumented tables. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated scaling.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: This variable controls how the server handles clients that are not aware of the sandbox mode. If enabled, the server disconnects the client, otherwise the server puts the client in a sandbox mode.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of table cache instances

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The location and name of the file that remembers where the SQL replication thread is in the relay logs.
Default value for the FOR SYSTEM_TIME AS OF clause

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The AUTOINC lock modes supported by InnoDB: 0 => Old style AUTOINC locking (for backward compatibility); 1 => New style AUTOINC locking; 2 => No AUTOINC locking (unsafe for SBR)
Maximum number of memory pool instruments.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Set the language used for the error messages

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Log slow OPTIMIZE, ANALYZE, ALTER and other administrative statements to the slow log if it is open.  Resets or sets the option 'admin' in log_slow_disabled_statements

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Wait until History list length is below the specified limit

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Case sensitivity of file names on the file system where the data directory is located

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Filename to/from which to dump/load the InnoDB buffer pool

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If non-zero, number of threads to spawn to apply in parallel events on the slave that were group-committed on the master or were logged with GTID in different replication domains. Note that these threads are in addition to the IO and SQL threads, which are always created by a replication slave
Maximum delay of user threads in micro-seconds

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: binlog format to take effect over user's choice
Trigger an immediate dump of the buffer pool into a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename
Define threads usage for handling queries
Enable InnoDB monitor output to the error log.

READ_ONLY: If a read on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable or Disable Truncate of UNDO tablespace.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The character set for statements that arrive from the client

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable InnoDB adaptive hash index (disabled by default).

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If there is more than this number of failed connect attempts due to invalid password, user will be blocked from further connections until FLUSH_PRIVILEGES.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: This variable is for internal server use

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Socket file to use for connection

GLOBAL_VALUE: Version of the used SSL library

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The soft upper limit for number of cached stored routines for one connection.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Flush MyISAM tables to disk between SQL commands

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: CRL file in PEM format (check OpenSSL docs, implies --ssl)
Command(s) that are executed by a slave server each time the SQL thread starts

READ_ONLY: Auto-increment columns are incremented by this

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The size of the statement cache for updates to non-transactional engines for the binary log. If you often use statements updating a great number of rows, you can increase this to get more performance.

READ_ONLY: Amount of memory a single user session is allowed to allocate. This limits the value of the session variable MEM_USED

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Whether the binary log can be compressed
Enables automatic relay log recovery right after the database startup, which means that the IO Thread starts re-fetching from the master right after the last transaction processed.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Log all queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute to the slow query log file. The argument will be treated as a decimal value with microsecond precision

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Whether to disable OS system file cache for sort I/O

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Restricts the total memory used for memory mapping of MySQL tables
Use this many iops for background key rotation

GLOBAL_VALUE: The proxy user account name used when logging in
If the server supports dynamic loading of plugins, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The collation of the connection character set

READ_ONLY: Log some not critical warnings to the general log file.Value can be between 0 and 11. Higher values mean more verbosity

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Print all deadlocks to MariaDB error log (off by default)
Enable traditional statistic calculation based on number of configured pages (default true)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Sets the total size of the transactional cache

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Don't log certain types of statements to slow log
Use old password encryption method (needed for 4.0 and older clients)
Percentage of dirty pages allowed in bufferpool.

READ_ONLY: Number of seconds to wait for a block to be written to a connection before aborting the write

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of metadata locks. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated scaling.
Maximum number of instrumented hosts. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
The size of the buffer used for index blocks for MyISAM tables. Increase this to get better index handling (for all reads and multiple writes) to as much as you can afford

READ_ONLY: The number of bytes to use when sorting BLOB or TEXT values (only the first max_sort_length bytes of each value are used; the rest are ignored)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: File format constraint for ALTER TABLE

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: SET pseudo_slave_mode= 0,1 are commands that mysqlbinlog adds to beginning and end of binary log dumps. While zero value indeed disables, the actual enabling of the slave applier execution mode is done implicitly when a Format_description_event is sent through the session.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Synchronously flush relay log to disk after every #th event. Use 0 to disable synchronous flushing
After this many write locks, allow some read locks to run in between

READ_ONLY: Default encryption key id used for table encryption.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Desired maximum UNDO tablespace size in bytes
Maximum length of displayed sql text.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: The strategy parameter is used to tune the compression algorithm. Use the value DEFAULT_STRATEGY for normal data, FILTERED for data produced by a filter (or predictor), HUFFMAN_ONLY to force Huffman encoding only (no string match), or RLE to limit match distances to one (run-length encoding). Filtered data consists mostly of small values with a somewhat random distribution. In this case, the compression algorithm is tuned to compress them better. The effect of FILTERED is to force more Huffman coding and less string matching; it is somewhat intermediate between DEFAULT_STRATEGY and HUFFMAN_ONLY. RLE is designed to be almost as fast as HUFFMAN_ONLY, but give better compression for PNG image data. The strategy parameter only affects the compression ratio but not the correctness of the compressed output even if it is not set appropriately. FIXED prevents the use of dynamic Huffman codes, allowing for a simpler decoder for special applications.

READ_ONLY: The maximum size of the container of a rowid filter

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of instrumented files. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Number of seconds to wait for more data from any master/slave connection before aborting the read

READ_ONLY: Size of tree cache used in bulk insert optimisation. Note that this is a limit per thread!
Maximum allowed size of an optimizer trace

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Threadpool priority. High priority connections usually start executing earlier than low priority.If priority set to 'auto', the the actual priority(low or high) is determined based on whether or not connection is inside transaction.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The minimum percentage of warm blocks in key cache

GLOBAL_VALUE: The type of license the server has

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable semi-synchronous replication master (disabled by default).

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Percentage of log capacity below which no adaptive flushing happens.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The memory allocated to store results from old queries

Do not defragment a single index more than this number of time per second.This controls the number of time defragmentation thread can request X_LOCK on an index. Defragmentation thread will check whether 1/defragment_frequency (s) has passed since it worked on this index last time, and put the index back to the queue if not enough time has passed. The actual frequency can only be lower than this given number.

GLOBAL_VALUE: The list of global transaction IDs that were last replicated on the server, one for each replication domain.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1, single-row INSERTs will produce a string containing warning information if a warning occurs.
Should slave thread do secondary index uniqueness checks
When password validation plugins are enabled, reject passwords that cannot be validated (passwords specified as a hash)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Size of the mutex/lock wait array.
Maximum time, in microseconds, to wait for more commits to queue up for binlog group commit. Only takes effect if the value of binlog_commit_wait_count is non-zero.
When wsrep_gtid_mode is set, this value is used as gtid_domain_id for galera transactions and also copied to the joiner nodes during state transfer. It is ignored, otherwise.

READ_ONLY: Each thread that does a sequential scan allocates a buffer of this size for each table it scans. If you do many sequential scans, you may want to increase this value

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum query execution time in milliseconds,before an executing non-yielding thread is considered stalled.If a worker thread is stalled, additional worker thread may be created to handle remaining clients.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set, reject DDL on affected tables not supporting Galera replication

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of opened instrumented sockets. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Default transaction access mode. If set to OFF, the default, access is read/write. If set to ON, access is read-only. The SET TRANSACTION statement can also change the value of this variable. See SET TRANSACTION and START TRANSACTION.
TLS protocol version for secure connections.
Whether to use read ahead for random access within an extent.

READ_ONLY: Don't write queries to slow log that examine fewer rows than that

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of leaf index pages to sample when calculating persistent statistics (by ANALYZE, default 20)
Port number to use for connection or 0 to default to, my.cnf, $MYSQL_TCP_PORT, /etc/services, built-in default (3306), whatever comes first
A dedicated thread is created to flush all tables at the given interval

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Invalidate queries in query cache on LOCK for write

GLOBAL_VALUE: The internal GTID state of the binlog, used to keep track of all GTIDs ever logged to the binlog.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to FALSE (the default), then when --log-bin is used, creation of a stored function (or trigger) is allowed only to users having the SUPER privilege and only if this stored function (trigger) may not break binary logging. Note that if ALL connections to this server ALWAYS use row-based binary logging, the security issues do not exist and the binary logging cannot break, so you can safely set this to TRUE

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The tracing level for semi-sync replication.
Maximum allowed number of worker threads in the thread pool
Block size to be used for MyISAM index pages
Synchronously flush binary log to disk after every #th event. Use 0 (default) to disable synchronous flushing
Sets the total size of the statement cache

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Alias for alter_algorithm. Deprecated. Use --alter-algorithm instead.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Encrypt temporary files (created for filesort, binary log cache, etc)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum delay between polling for a spin lock (4 by default)

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: OFF = Don't cache or retrieve results. ON = Cache all results except SELECT SQL_NO_CACHE ... queries. DEMAND = Cache only SELECT SQL_CACHE ... queries

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Include delete marked records when calculating persistent statistics

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: How many defragment stats changes there are before the stats are written to persistent storage. Set to 0 meaning disable defragment stats tracking.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Set the language used for the month names and the days of the week

READ_ONLY: Timeout in seconds an InnoDB transaction may wait for a lock before being rolled back. Values above 100000000 disable the timeout.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Don't start more than this number of threads to handle INSERT DELAYED statements. If set to zero INSERT DELAYED will be not used
Move blocks to the 'new' end of the buffer pool if the first access was at least this many milliseconds ago. The timeout is disabled if 0.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Wait until timeout when no semi-synchronous replication slave available (enabled by default).

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Internal server usage, manually set WSREP GTID seqno.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The size of the transactional cache for updates to transactional engines for the binary log. If you often use transactions containing many statements, you can increase this to get more performance

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Master connection to use for all slave variables and slave commands

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1,listener thread will not pick up queries

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If the compression failure rate of a table is greater than this number more padding is added to the pages to reduce the failures. A value of zero implies no padding

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Use MySQL-5.6 (instead of MariaDB-5.3) format for TIME, DATETIME, TIMESTAMP columns.

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Whether mysqld was locked in memory with --memlock

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Log queries that are executed without benefit of any index to the slow log if it is open. Same as log_slow_filter='not_using_index'

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: How many pages to flush on LRU eviction

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Tell InnoDB to stop any writes to disk

GLOBAL_VALUE: The external user account used when logging in

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable prefix optimization to sometimes avoid cluster index lookups.

GLOBAL_VALUE: Version of the used malloc library

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Tells the slave to restrict replication to tables in the comma-separated list.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Tells the slave thread to continue replication when a query event returns an error from the provided list

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Dump only the hottest N% of each buffer pool, defaults to 25

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable encryption for tables. Don't forget to enable --innodb-encrypt-log too

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Command(s) that are executed for each new connection (unless the user has SUPER privilege)
The collation of the database character set

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of cached table definitions

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Specifies Aria group commit mode. Possible values are "none" (no group commit), "hard" (with waiting to actual commit), "soft" (no wait for commit (DANGEROUS!!!))

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The size of the buffer which InnoDB uses to write log to the log files on disk.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Modes for how triggers in row-base replication on slave side will be executed. Legal values are NO (default), YES, LOGGING and ENFORCE. NO means that trigger for RBR will not be running on slave. YES and LOGGING means that triggers will be running on slave, if there was not triggers running on the master for the statement. LOGGING also means results of that the executed triggers work will be written to the binlog. ENFORCE means that triggers will always be run on the slave, even if there are triggers on the master. ENFORCE implies LOGGING.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: How many host names should be cached to avoid resolving.
Desired maximum length of the purge queue (0 = no limit)

READ_ONLY: Don't start more than this number of threads to handle INSERT DELAYED statements. If set to zero INSERT DELAYED will be not used

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Don't use the fast sort index method to created index if the temporary file would get bigger than this
How deep to scan LRU to keep it clean

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: The value to be returned from LAST_INSERT_ID()
Used to emulate old behavior from earlier MariaDB or MySQL versions

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: This defines the global password expiration policy. 0 means automatic password expiration is disabled. If the value is a positive integer N, the passwords must be changed every N days. This behavior can be overridden using the password expiration options in ALTER USER.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Default flags for the regex library
Use compatible behavior from previous MariaDB version. See also --old-mode
Specifies type of the histograms created by ANALYZE. Possible values are: SINGLE_PREC_HB - single precision height-balanced, DOUBLE_PREC_HB - double precision height-balanced.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: How many threads we should keep in a cache for reuse. These are freed after 5 minutes of idle time

GLOBAL_VALUE: If the zlib compression library is accessible to the server, this will be set to YES, otherwise it will be NO. The COMPRESS() and UNCOMPRESS() functions will only be available if set to YES.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The interval, in seconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received.If set to 0, system dependent default is used.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable atomic writes, instead of using the doublewrite buffer, for files on devices that supports atomic writes. This option only works on Linux with either FusionIO cards using the directFS filesystem or with Shannon cards using any file system.
Force checksum verification of logged events in the binary log before sending them to slaves or printing them in the output of SHOW BINLOG EVENTS

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Enable proxy protocol for these source networks. The syntax is a comma separated list of IPv4 and IPv6 networks. If the network doesn't contain mask, it is considered to be a single host. "*" represents all networks and must the only directive on the line. String "localhost" represents non-TCP local connections (Unix domain socket, Windows named pipe or shared memory).

GLOBAL_VALUE: Current GTID position of the server. Per replication domain, this is either the last GTID replicated by a slave thread, or the GTID logged to the binary log, whichever is most recent.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable InnoDB doublewrite buffer (enabled by default). Disable with --skip-innodb-doublewrite.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: What form of binary logging the master will use: either ROW for row-based binary logging, STATEMENT for statement-based binary logging, or MIXED. MIXED is statement-based binary logging except for those statements where only row-based is correct: those which involve user-defined functions (i.e. UDFs) or the UUID() function; for those, row-based binary logging is automatically used.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: InnoDB persistent statistics enabled for all tables unless overridden at table level

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Percentage of rows from the table ANALYZE TABLE will sample to collect table statistics. Set to 0 to let MariaDB decide what percentage of rows to sample.

READ_ONLY: The default week format used by WEEK() functions

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Don't overwrite stale .MYD and .MYI even if no directory is specified

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum on-disk size of change buffer in terms of percentage of the buffer pool.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: List of operators for MATCH ... AGAINST ( ... IN BOOLEAN MODE)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: The default ROW FORMAT for all innodb tables created without explicit ROW_FORMAT. Possible values are REDUNDANT, COMPACT, and DYNAMIC. The ROW_FORMAT value COMPRESSED is not allowed

How replication events should be executed. Legal values are STRICT and IDEMPOTENT (default). In IDEMPOTENT mode, replication will not stop for DDL operations that are idempotent. This means that CREATE TABLE is treated as CREATE TABLE OR REPLACE and DROP TABLE is treated as DROP TABLE IF EXISTS.
Use native AIO if supported on this platform.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The character set used by the default database

GLOBAL_VALUE: If statement profiling is available, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO. See SHOW PROFILES and SHOW PROFILE.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of undo tablespaces to use.

READ_ONLY: Used with global transaction ID to identify logically independent replication streams. When events can propagate through multiple parallel paths (for example multiple masters), each independent source server must use a distinct domain_id. For simple tree-shaped replication topologies, it can be left at its default, 0.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: A number between [0, 100] that tells how oftern buffer pool dump status in percentages should be printed. E.g. 10 means that buffer pool dump status is printed when every 10% of number of buffer pool pages are dumped. Default is 0 (only start and end status is printed).

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Set the time for this client

READ_ONLY: Short search depth for the two-step deadlock detection

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: InnoDB Fulltext search minimum token size in characters

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: User supplied stopword table name, effective in the session level.
Should slave thread do foreign key constraint checks

READ_ONLY: Uniquely identifies the server instance in the community of replication partners

GLOBAL_VALUE: If the server supports the query cache, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Don't use the fast sort index method to created index if the temporary file would get bigger than this.
Number of times the slave SQL thread will retry a transaction in case it failed with a deadlock, elapsed lock wait timeout or listed in slave_transaction_retry_errors, before giving up and stopping

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Path to files and their sizes making temp-tablespace.

READ_ONLY: Maximum number of iterations when executing recursive queries

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Log errors to file (instead of stdout).  If file name is not specified then 'datadir'/'log-basename'.err or the 'pid-file' path with extension .err is used

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Controls syncing directory after log file growth and new file creation

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Limit LOAD DATA, SELECT ... OUTFILE, and LOAD_FILE() to files within specified directory

READ_ONLY: If larger than 1, when repairing a MyISAM table all indexes will be created in parallel, with one thread per index. The value of 1 disables parallel repair
Max size for data for an internal temporary on-disk MyISAM or Aria table.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Interval between commits in microseconds (1/1000000 sec). 0 stands for no waiting for other threads to come and do a commit in "hard" mode and no sync()/commit at all in "soft" mode.  Option has only an effect if aria_group_commit is used

If this is not 0, then mysqld will use this value to reserve file descriptors to use with setrlimit(). If this value is 0 or autoset then mysqld will reserve max_connections*5 or max_connections + table_cache*2 (whichever is larger) number of file descriptors

READ_ONLY: Number of statements about which profiling information is maintained. If set to 0, no profiles are stored. See SHOW PROFILES.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of rows modified before we calculate new statistics (default 0 = current limits)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: The version of the client/server protocol used by the MariaDB server

Run fast part of group commit in a single thread, to optimize kernel thread scheduling. On by default. Disable to run each transaction in group commit in its own thread, which can be slower at very high concurrency. This option is mostly for testing one algorithm versus the other, and it should not normally be necessary to change it.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The location and name to use for relay logs.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The maximum number of rows to return from SELECT statements

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Log connections and queries to a table or log file. Defaults logging to a file 'hostname'.log or a table mysql.general_logif --log-output=TABLE is used.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Specifies how Aria index statistics collection code should treat NULLs

READ_ONLY: Buffer length for TCP/IP and socket communication

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Force checksum verification of replication events after reading them from relay log. Note: Events are always checksum-verified by slave on receiving them from the network before writing them to the relay log
Compression algorithm used on page compression. One of: none, zlib, lz4, lzo, lzma, bzip2, or snappy

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Interval of the slave SQL thread will retry a transaction in case it failed with a deadlock or elapsed lock wait timeout or listed in slave_transaction_retry_errors

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: The lowest desirable plugin maturity. Plugins less mature than that will not be installed or loaded

GLOBAL_VALUE: If the crypt() system call is available this variable will be set to YES, otherwise it will be set to NO. If set to NO, the ENCRYPT() function cannot be used.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of tasks for purging transaction history
Number of slave appliers to launch

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1 (0 is default), statement profiling will be enabled. See SHOW PROFILES and SHOW PROFILE.

GLOBAL_VALUE: Comparing have_openssl with have_ssl will indicate whether YaSSL or openssl was used. If YaSSL, have_ssl will be YES, but have_openssl will be NO.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The size of the buffer used for index blocks for Aria tables. Increase this to get better index handling (for all reads and multiple writes) to as much as you can afford.

READ_ONLY: The maximum number of rows a subquery may examine in order to be executed during optimization and used for constant optimization
The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a connection before closing it

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Dump the buffer pool into a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename

READ_ONLY: The maximum weight of the SEL_ARG graph. Set to 0 for no limit

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: CA file in PEM format (check OpenSSL docs, implies --ssl)

READ_ONLY: Long search depth for the two-step deadlock detection

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Track changes to the default schema.

READ_ONLY: Size of buffer to use when using MRR with range access

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Size of each log file in a log group.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Percentage of dirty pages at which flushing kicks in. The value 0 (default) means 'refer to innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct'.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1, the default, warning_count is incremented each time a Note warning is encountered. If set to 0, Note warnings are not recorded. mysqldump has outputs to set this variable to 0 so that no unnecessary increments occur when data is reloaded.

READ_ONLY: The number of seconds the server waits for write idle transaction

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1 (the default) foreign key constraints (including ON UPDATE and ON DELETE behavior) InnoDB tables are checked, while if set to 0, they are not checked. 0 is not recommended for normal use, though it can be useful in situations where you know the data is consistent, but want to reload data in a different order from that that specified by parent/child relationships. Setting this variable to 1 does not retrospectively check for inconsistencies introduced while set to 0.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Internal server usage, for replication with global transaction id. When set, next event group logged to the binary log will use this sequence number, not generate a new one, thus allowing to preserve master's GTID in slave's binlog.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1 (0 is default), results from SELECT statements are always placed into temporary tables. This can help the server when it takes a long time to send the results to the client by allowing the table locks to be freed early.

InnoDB automatic recalculation of persistent statistics enabled for all tables unless overridden at table level (automatic recalculation is only done when InnoDB decides that the table has changed too much and needs a new statistics)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum length considered for digest text, when stored in performance_schema tables.

If non-zero, binlog write will wait at most binlog_commit_wait_usec microseconds for at least this many commits to queue up for group commit to the binlog. This can reduce I/O on the binlog and provide increased opportunity for parallel apply on the slave, but too high a value will decrease commit throughput.
Maximum number of seconds that semaphore times out in InnoDB.

GLOBAL_VALUE: The full path of the relay log file names, excluding the extension.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: InnoDB Fulltext search parallel sort degree, will round up to nearest power of 2 number

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Track changes to the transaction attributes. OFF to disable; STATE to track just transaction state (Is there an active transaction? Does it have any data? etc.); CHARACTERISTICS to track transaction state and report all statements needed to start a transaction with the same characteristics (isolation level, read only/read write,snapshot - but not any work done / data modified within the transaction).

GLOBAL_VALUE: File that holds the names for last binary log files.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Percentage of B-tree page filled during bulk insert

READ_ONLY: Number of seconds to wait for more data from a connection before aborting the read

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Attempt flushing dirty pages to avoid IO bursts at checkpoints.

GLOBAL_VALUE: The full path of the binary log file names, excluding the extension.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Stores each InnoDB table to an .ibd file in the database dir.

READ_ONLY: Joins that are probably going to read more than max_join_size records return an error

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Extra port number to use for tcp connections in a one-thread-per-connection manner. 0 means don't use another port

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enforce strict seq_no ordering of events in the binary log. Slave stops with an error if it encounters an event that would cause it to generate an out-of-order binlog if executed.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Block size to be used for Aria index pages.

Limit on how much memory SQL threads should use per parallel replication thread when reading ahead in the relay log looking for opportunities for parallel replication. Only used when --slave-parallel-threads > 0.
The number of milliseconds before a dequeued low-priority statement is moved to the high-priority queue

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Disallow authentication for accounts that have old (pre-4.1) passwords

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The common part for InnoDB table spaces.

GLOBAL_VALUE: Wsrep patch version, for example wsrep_25.10.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of background read I/O threads in InnoDB.

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Tell the slave to restrict replication to updates of tables whose names do not appear in the comma-separated list. For statement-based replication, only the default database (that is, the one selected by USE) is considered, not any explicitly mentioned tables in the query. For row-based replication, the actual names of table(s) being updated are checked.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of background write I/O threads in InnoDB.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Disable initialization of builtin InnoDB plugin

READ_ONLY: The size of the buffer that is allocated when preloading indexes

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Directory where undo tablespace files live, this path can be absolute.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1, provides better statistics in information_schema threadpool tables

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Old variable, which if set to 1, allows large result sets by saving all temporary sets to disk, avoiding 'table full' errors. No longer needed, as the server now handles this automatically.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Synchronously flush relay log info to disk after every #th transaction. Use 0 to disable synchronous flushing
InnoDB Fulltext search query result cache limit in bytes

Port for connecting to slave reported to the master during slave registration. Set it only if the slave is listening on a non-default port or if you have a special tunnel from the master or other clients to the slave. If not sure, leave this option unset

READ_ONLY: Ensure "synchronous" read view before executing an operation of the type specified by bitmask: 1 - READ(includes SELECT, SHOW and BEGIN/START TRANSACTION); 2 - UPDATE and DELETE; 4 - INSERT and REPLACE

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of unacknowledged probes to send before considering the connection dead and notifying the application layer.If set to 0, system dependent default is used.

READ_ONLY: Controls what join operations can be executed with join buffers. Odd numbers are used for plain join buffers while even numbers are used for linked buffers

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Key rotation - re-encrypt in background all pages that were encrypted with a key that many (or more) versions behind. Value 0 indicates that key rotation is disabled.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Should MariaDB slave be restarted automatically, when node joins back to cluster

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Controls tracing of the Optimizer: optimizer_trace=option=val[,option=val...], where option is one of {enabled} and val is one of {on, off, default}

GLOBAL_VALUE: Source control revision id for MariaDB source code

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: When this option is enabled, connections attempted using insecure transport will be rejected. Secure transports are SSL/TLS, Unix sockets or named pipes.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of pages that must be accessed sequentially for InnoDB to trigger a readahead.
The number of connections on extra-port

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Start InnoDB in read only mode (off by default)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Skip the next N events from the master log

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: If set when a transaction is written to the binlog, parallel apply of that transaction will be avoided on a slave where slave_parallel_mode is not "aggressive". Can be used to avoid unnecessary rollback and retry for transactions that are likely to cause a conflict if replicated in parallel.
Reset all values for a monitor counter

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of cached open tables

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Only optimize the Fulltext index of the table

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: If set to 1 table names are stored in lowercase on disk and table names will be case-insensitive.  Should be set to 2 if you are using a case insensitive file system

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Specifies how InnoDB index statistics collection code should treat NULLs. Possible values are NULLS_EQUAL (default), NULLS_UNEQUAL and NULLS_IGNORED

GLOBAL_VALUE: The machine type or architecture MariaDB was built on, for example i686.

If the server supports secure connections, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO. If set to DISABLED, the server was compiled with TLS support, but was not started with TLS support (see the mysqld options). See also have_openssl.

READ_ONLY: Write to slow log every #th slow query. Set to 1 to log everything. Increase it to reduce the size of the slow or the performance impact of slow logging

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Certify tables with no primary key

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of thread groups in the pool. This parameter is roughly equivalent to maximum number of concurrently executing threads (threads in a waiting state do not count as executing).
Max number of rows in write set
The size of the memory buffer InnoDB uses to cache data and indexes of its tables.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Don't log certain types of statements to general log

READ_ONLY: Precision of the result of '/' operator will be increased on that value

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Trigger an immediate load of the buffer pool from a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Specifies a directory to add to the ignore list when collecting database names from the datadir. Put a blank argument to reset the list accumulated so far.
The account user name of the slave to be reported to the master during slave registration

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Type of BINLOG_CHECKSUM_ALG. Include checksum for log events in the binary log

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Strip all comments from a query before storing it in the query cache

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Page size to use for all InnoDB tablespaces.

READ_ONLY: Size of transaction fragments for streaming replication (measured in units of 'wsrep_trx_fragment_unit')

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Encrypt tables (only for tables with ROW_FORMAT=PAGE (default) and not FIXED/DYNAMIC)

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: The default storage engine for user-created temporary tables

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of rows in EVENTS_STATEMENTS_HISTORY_LONG. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Tells the master to annotate RBR events with the statement that caused these events

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Should transaction wait for semi-sync ack after having synced binlog, or after having committed in storage engine.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Log slow statements executed by slave thread to the slow log if it is open. Resets or sets the option 'slave' in log_slow_disabled_statements

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of bytes that the transaction log has to grow between checkpoints before a new checkpoint is written to the log.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1 adds an implicate IF EXISTS to ALTER, RENAME and DROP of TABLES, VIEWS, FUNCTIONS and PACKAGES

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Controls the durability/speed trade-off for commits. Set to 0 (write and flush redo log to disk only once per second), 1 (flush to disk at each commit), 2 (write to log at commit but flush to disk only once per second) or 3 (flush to disk at prepare and at commit, slower and usually redundant). 1 and 3 guarantees that after a crash, committed transactions will not be lost and will be consistent with the binlog and other transactional engines. 2 can get inconsistent and lose transactions if there is a power failure or kernel crash but not if mysqld crashes. 0 has no guarantees in case of crash. 0 and 2 can be faster than 1 or 3.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Semicolon (;) separated list of wsrep options (see wsrep_provider_options documentation).

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of opened instrumented files.
Maximum number of prepared statements in the server

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: To convert locking sessions into transactions

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: preferred donor node for the SST
Name of this node. This name can be used in wsrep_sst_donor as a preferred donor. Note that multiple nodes in a cluster can have the same name.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Percentage of empty space on a data page that can be reserved to make the page compressible.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: To commit LOAD DATA transaction after every 10K rows inserted (deprecated)

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Log connections and queries to given file

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: The value to be used by the following INSERT or ALTER TABLE statement when inserting an AUTO_INCREMENT value

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Changes are logged into the binary log with the @@skip_replication flag set. Such events will not be replicated by slaves that run with --replicate-events-marked-for-skip set different from its default of REPLICATE. See Selectively skipping replication of binlog events for more information.

READ_ONLY: Short timeout for the two-step deadlock detection (in microseconds)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Automatically update the (joiner) node's wsrep_gtid_domain_id value with that of donor's (received during state transfer) and use it in place of gtid_domain_id for all galera transactions. When OFF (default), wsrep_gtid_domain_id is simply ignored (backward compatibility).

READ_ONLY: The size of the buffers used [NOT] IN evaluation via partial matching

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: How long a INSERT DELAYED thread should wait for INSERT statements before terminating

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Setting this variable is equivalent to setting wsrep_sync_wait READ flag

READ_ONLY: Minimum column data length eligible for compression

GLOBAL_VALUE: The GTID of the last commit (if binlogging was enabled), or the empty string if none.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable INFORMATION_SCHEMA.innodb_cmp_per_index, may have negative impact on performance (off by default)
Set of slave type conversions that are enabled. If the variable is empty, no conversions are allowed and it is expected that the types match exactly

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum modification log file size for online index creation
The minimum percentage of warm blocks in key cache

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: YES = Don't issue an error message (warning only) if a VIEW without presence of a key of the underlying table is used in queries with a LIMIT clause for updating. NO = Prohibit update of a VIEW, which does not contain a key of the underlying table and the query uses a LIMIT clause (usually get from GUI tools)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable/disable InnoDB defragmentation (default FALSE). When set to FALSE, all existing defragmentation will be paused. And new defragmentation command will fail.Paused defragmentation commands will resume when this variable is set to true again.

READ_ONLY: The minimum number of scalar elements in the value list of IN predicate that triggers its conversion to IN subquery. Set to 0 to disable the conversion.
Allocation block size for query parsing and execution

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1 (0 is the default), no logging to the general query log is done for the client. Only clients with the SUPER privilege can update this variable.

If set to 1, the default, the server will quote identifiers for SHOW CREATE DATABASE, SHOW CREATE TABLE and SHOW CREATE VIEW statements. Quoting is disabled if set to 0. Enable to ensure replications works when identifiers require quoting.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Size of a single memory chunk for resizing buffer pool. Online buffer pool resizing happens at this granularity. 0 means disable resizing buffer pool.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Specifies the node's network address, in the format ip address[:port]. Used in situations where autoguessing is not reliable. As of MariaDB 10.1.8, supports IPv6.
Log slow queries to given log file. Defaults logging to 'hostname'-slow.log. Must be enabled to activate other slow log options

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Certification rules to use in the cluster. Possible values are: "strict": stricter rules that could result in more certification failures. "optimized": relaxed rules that allow more concurrency and cause less certification failures.

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Tell the slave to restrict replication to updates of tables whose names appear in the comma-separated list. For statement-based replication, only the default database (that is, the one selected by USE) is considered, not any explicitly mentioned tables in the query. For row-based replication, the actual names of table(s) being updated are checked.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of opened instrumented tables. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Abort a currently running load of the buffer pool

How replication events should be executed. Legal values are STRICT (default) and IDEMPOTENT. In IDEMPOTENT mode, replication will not stop for operations that are idempotent. For example, in row based replication attempts to delete rows that doesn't exist will be ignored. In STRICT mode, replication will stop on any unexpected difference between the master and the slave.
The number of errors, warnings, and notes that resulted from the last statement that generated messages

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Specifies how MyISAM index statistics collection code should treat NULLs. Possible values of name are NULLS_UNEQUAL (default behavior for 4.1 and later), NULLS_EQUAL (emulate 4.0 behavior), and NULLS_IGNORED

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Read SQL commands from this file at startup

READ_ONLY: The buffer that is allocated when sorting the index when doing a REPAIR or when creating indexes with CREATE INDEX or ALTER TABLE
The number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Percentage of the buffer pool to reserve for 'old' blocks.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: The number of errors that resulted from the last statement that generated messages

READ_ONLY: Max number of errors/warnings to store for a statement

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The location where the slave should put its temporary files when replicating a LOAD DATA INFILE command

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The minimum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index. Note: FULLTEXT indexes must be rebuilt after changing this variable

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Controls what transactions are applied in parallel when using --slave-parallel-threads. Possible values: "optimistic" tries to apply most transactional DML in parallel, and handles any conflicts with rollback and retry. "conservative" limits parallelism in an effort to avoid any conflicts. "aggressive" tries to maximise the parallelism, possibly at the cost of increased conflict rate. "minimal" only parallelizes the commit steps of transactions. "none" disables parallel apply completely.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Total memory allocated for InnoDB Fulltext Search cache

GLOBAL_VALUE: The location and name to use for the file that keeps a list of the last relay logs.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 1, the default, all queries are committed immediately. If set to 0, they are only committed upon a COMMIT statement, or rolled back with a ROLLBACK statement. If autocommit is set to 0, and then changed to 1, all open transactions are immediately committed.
Reject client queries when donating state snapshot transfer

READ_ONLY: The optimizer will use existing index statistics instead of doing index dives for equality ranges if the number of equality ranges for the index is larger than or equal to this number. If set to 0, index dives are always used.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The default size of key cache blocks
Interval between tries to do an automatic checkpoints. In seconds; 0 means 'no automatic checkpoints' which makes sense only for testing.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: With which method to flush data.

READ_ONLY: Persistent buffer for transactions to be stored in binary log

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: If set to 1, UPDATEs and DELETEs need either a key in the WHERE clause, or a LIMIT clause, or else they will aborted. Prevents the common mistake of accidentally deleting or updating every row in a table.

GLOBAL_VALUE: Operating system that MariaDB was built on, for example debian-linux-gnu.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable semi-synchronous replication slave (disabled by default).

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Controls whether rows should be logged in 'FULL', 'NOBLOB' or 'MINIMAL' formats. 'FULL', means that all columns in the before and after image are logged. 'NOBLOB', means that mysqld avoids logging blob columns whenever possible (eg, blob column was not changed or is not part of primary key). 'MINIMAL', means that a PK equivalent (PK columns or full row if there is no PK in the table) is logged in the before image, and only changed columns are logged in the after image. (Default: FULL).

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Use memory mapping for reading and writing MyISAM tables
Encrypt temporary on-disk tables (created as part of query execution)
Load the buffer pool from a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: InnoDB Fulltext search cache size in bytes

GLOBAL_VALUE: Server version number. It may also include a suffix with configuration or build information. -debug indicates debugging support was enabled on the server, and -log indicates at least one of the binary log, general log or slow query log are enabled, for example 10.1.1-MariaDB-mariadb1precise-log.

READ_ONLY: The number of seconds the server waits for read-only idle transaction

GLOBAL_VALUE: Last GTID logged to the binary log, per replicationdomain

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Whether the slave should replicate events that were created with @@skip_replication=1 on the master. Default REPLICATE (no events are skipped). Other values are FILTER_ON_SLAVE (events will be sent by the master but ignored by the slave) and FILTER_ON_MASTER (events marked with @@skip_replication=1 will be filtered on the master and never be sent to the slave).
Tells the slave to log the updates from the slave thread to the binary log. You will need to turn it on if you plan to daisy-chain the slaves.
Allow IO bursts at the checkpoints ignoring io_capacity setting.

READ_ONLY: Long timeout for the two-step deadlock detection (in microseconds)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum space to use for all relay logs
How many files at the maximum InnoDB keeps open at the same time.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Disable system thread alarm calls. Disabling it may be useful in debugging or testing, never do it in production

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Set option TCP_NODELAY (disable Nagle's algorithm) on socket

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Synchronously flush master info to disk after every #th event. Use 0 to disable synchronous flushing

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Don't resolve hostnames. All hostnames are IP's or 'localhost'.
Enable/disable InnoDB deadlock detector (default ON). if set to OFF, deadlock detection is skipped, and we rely on innodb_lock_wait_timeout in case of deadlock.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Maximum number of parallel threads to use on slave for events in a single replication domain. When using multiple domains, this can be used to limit a single domain from grabbing all threads and thus stalling other domains. The default of 0 means to allow a domain to grab as many threads as it wants, up to the value of slave_parallel_threads.
InnoDB Fulltext search maximum token size in characters

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Force the use of a storage engine for new tables

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The user supplied stopword table name.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Whether to enable additional FTS diagnostic printout

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: How many records of space defragmentation should leave on the page. This variable, together with innodb_defragment_fill_factor, is introduced so defragmentation won't pack the page too full and cause page split on the next insert on every page. The variable indicating more defragmentation gain is the one effective.

GLOBAL_VALUE: If symbolic link support is enabled, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO. Required for the INDEX DIRECTORY and DATA DIRECTORY table options (see CREATE TABLE) and Windows symlink support. Will be set to DISABLED if the server is started with the --skip-symbolic-links option.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The number of segments in a key cache
Number of pages considered at once when merging multiple pages to defragment
Set to 0 (don't flush neighbors from buffer pool), 1 (flush contiguous neighbors from buffer pool) or 2 (flush neighbors from buffer pool), when flushing a block

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Log only certain types of queries to the slow log. If variable empty alll kind of queries are logged.  All types are bound by slow_query_time, except 'not_using_index' which is always logged if enabled

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Restricts direct setting of a session timestamp. Possible levels are: YES - timestamp cannot deviate from the system clock, REPLICATION - replication thread can adjust timestamp to match the master's, SUPER - a user with this privilege and a replication thread can adjust timestamp, NO - historical behavior, anyone can modify session timestamp

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Path to installation directory. All paths are usually resolved relative to this

READ_ONLY: The buffer that is allocated when sorting the index when doing a REPAIR or when creating indexes with CREATE INDEX or ALTER TABLE.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Path to individual files and their sizes.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Recover database state after crash and exit

READ_ONLY: Controls selectivity of which conditions the optimizer takes into account to calculate cardinality of a partial join when it searches for the best execution plan Meaning: 1 - use selectivity of index backed range conditions to calculate the cardinality of a partial join if the last joined table is accessed by full table scan or an index scan, 2 - use selectivity of index backed range conditions to calculate the cardinality of a partial join in any case, 3 - additionally always use selectivity of range conditions that are not backed by any index to calculate the cardinality of a partial join, 4 - use histograms to calculate selectivity of range conditions that are not backed by any index to calculate the cardinality of a partial join.5 - additionally use selectivity of certain non-range predicates calculated on record samples

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Normally does not need tuning. How many old rows must accumulate in the mysql.gtid_slave_pos table before a background job will be run to delete them. Can be increased to reduce number of commits if using many different engines with --gtid_pos_auto_engines, or to reduce CPU overhead if using a huge number of different gtid_domain_ids. Can be decreased to reduce number of old rows in the table.

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: List of engines for which to automatically create a mysql.gtid_slave_pos_ENGINE table, if a transaction using that engine is replicated. This can be used to avoid introducing cross-engine transactions, if engines are used different from that used by table mysql.gtid_slave_pos

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: FTS internal auxiliary table to be checked

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of hash buckets for open and changed files.  If you have a lot of Aria files open you should increase this for faster flush of changes. A good value is probably 1/10 of number of possible open Aria files.

READ_ONLY: Limit assumed max number of seeks when looking up rows based on a key

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Redo log write ahead unit size to avoid read-on-write, it should match the OS cache block IO size

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Unit for streaming replication transaction fragments' size: bytes, rows, statements

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The minimum size for blocks allocated by the query cache
Maximum speed(KB/s) to read binlog from master (0 = no limit)

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Enable statistics gathering for metadata commands such as SHOW TABLE STATUS for tables that use transient statistics (off by default)

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: The stack size for each thread

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Force InnoDB to load metadata of corrupted table.
Specifies how Aria transactional log will be purged

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Whether the binary log is enabled

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Previously showed the size of large memory pages, unused since multiple page size support was added

GLOBAL_VALUE_ORIGIN: Tells the slave thread to not replicate to the tables that match the given wildcard pattern.

READ_ONLY: When reading rows in sorted order after a sort, the rows are read through this buffer to avoid a disk seeks

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: The algorithm InnoDB uses for page checksumming. Possible values are FULL_CRC32 for new files, always use CRC-32C; for old, see CRC32 below; STRICT_FULL_CRC32 for new files, always use CRC-32C; for old, see STRICT_CRC32 below; CRC32 write crc32, allow any of the other checksums to match when reading; STRICT_CRC32 write crc32, do not allow other algorithms to match when reading; INNODB write a software calculated checksum, allow any other checksums to match when reading; STRICT_INNODB write a software calculated checksum, do not allow other algorithms to match when reading; NONE write a constant magic number, do not do any checksum verification when reading (same as innodb_checksums=OFF); STRICT_NONE write a constant magic number, do not allow values other than that magic number when reading; Files updated when this option is set to crc32 or strict_crc32 will not be readable by MariaDB versions older than 10.0.4; new files created with full_crc32 are readable by MariaDB 10.4.3+
Whether there is an active transaction

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Address where node is waiting for SST contact

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: To desynchronize the node from the cluster

READ_ONLY: Maximum depth of search performed by the query optimizer. Values larger than the number of relations in a query result in better query plans, but take longer to compile a query. Values smaller than the number of tables in a relation result in faster optimization, but may produce very bad query plans. If set to 0, the system will automatically pick a reasonable value.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Track changes to the session state.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Timeout, in seconds, with no activity until the first TCP keep-alive packet is sent.If set to 0, system dependent default is used.

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: The current time zone, used to initialize the time zone for a client when it connects. Set to SYSTEM by default, in which the client uses the system time zone value.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Make all non-temporary tables read-only, with the exception for replication (slave) threads and users with the SUPER privilege
Enables statistics gathering for USER_STATISTICS, CLIENT_STATISTICS, INDEX_STATISTICS and TABLE_STATISTICS tables in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA
Track changes in registered system variables.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Number of UNDO log pages to purge in one batch from the history list.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Do not allow creating a table without primary key (off by default)

READ_ONLY: Number of bytes used for a histogram. If set to 0, no histograms are created by ANALYZE.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Allow reads even when the node is not in the primary component.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Helps to save your data in case the disk image of the database becomes corrupt. Value 5 can return bogus data, and 6 can permanently corrupt data.

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: A number between [0.7, 1] that tells defragmentation how full it should fill a page. Default is 0.9. Number below 0.7 won't make much sense.This variable, together with innodb_defragment_fill_factor_n_recs, is introduced so defragmentation won't pack the page too full and cause page split on the next insert on every page. The variable indicating more defragmentation gain is the one effective.

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: Tells the slave to write annotate rows events received from the master to its own binary log. Ignored if log_slave_updates is not set

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Specifies how to use system statistics tables

NUMERIC_BLOCK_SIZE: If set to 0 (1 is the default), no logging to the binary log is done for the client. Only clients with the SUPER privilege can update this variable. Can have unintended consequences if set globally, see SET SQL_LOG_BIN. Starting MariaDB 10.1.7, this variable does not affect the replication of events in a Galera cluster.

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Speeds up the shutdown process of the InnoDB storage engine. Possible values are 0, 1 (faster), 2 (crash-like), 3 (fastest clean).
Maximum number of instrumented users. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
Dictates rate at which UNDO records are purged. Value N means purge rollback segment(s) on every Nth iteration of purge invocation
The number of outstanding connection requests MariaDB can have. This comes into play when the main MariaDB thread gets very many connection requests in a very short time
Count of spin-loop rounds in InnoDB mutexes (30 by default)

GLOBAL_VALUE_PATH: Path for temporary files. Several paths may be specified, separated by a colon (:), in this case they are used in a round-robin fashion

NUMERIC_MAX_VALUE: Sets the internal state of the RAND() generator for replication purposes

NUMERIC_MIN_VALUE: Compression level used for zlib compression.  0 is no compression, 1 is fastest, 9 is best compression and default is 6.
